programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: While responding to a complaint, Burgess and Sorensen find the body of a 16-year-old girl in a baseball player's (Billy Burke) house; Lindsay receives a mysterious delivery that might have ties to her past.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: When the only witness to the rape and murder of a young man gets killed, the team suspects that someone was paid to take the victim out; Antonio receives a job offer from the state attorney's office.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: A highly trained killer is believed to be targeting the police department; Lindsay speaks to Antonio about his job with the state's attorney.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Severide is brought in for questioning after it is discovered that his car has been involved in a deadly crash; Lindsay considers meeting her estranged father.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Evidence from the case of a young woman who was shot to death confirms the Chicago P.D. has a serial killer on its hands; Voight welcomes Kenny Rixton to the team when Ruzek takes another assignment.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: The investigation into the murder of a sex offender leads to a private police force operating independently of the Chicago PD; Halstead checks Jimmy's DNA to find out if he really is Lindsay's father.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: A priest and parishioners block law enforcement from entering a church where two murder suspects are suspected of hiding; Rixton is caught in a lie with Voight.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: When the crushed body of a young teen who ran away from a treatment center for troubled girls is found in an abandoned building, Voight sends Halstead under cover as a guard to investigate the center from the inside.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: The team investigates a home explosion that left a charred body, one injured survivor and no witnesses; Lindsay and Halstead receive a strange warning about Rixton.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Olinsky goes under cover as a hit man for hire after Lindsay is tipped off about a grieving father looking to avenge his daughter's death; when Ruzek returns from his undercover assignment, Voight puts him on patrol duty.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Olinsky's daughter is in critical condition following a massive warehouse fire; Voight investigates the fire's potential origins; intelligence examines connections between the building owner, those who were inside, and potential arson suspects.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: A hiker leads intelligence to a young woman being held captive in the woods near Chicago; a former relationship of Halstead's comes back into the picture, much to the surprise of Lindsay.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: The investigation leads Intelligence to one of Chicago's wealthiest families after a nighttime photographer is murdered over a piece of mysterious footage; Burgess' sister Nicole visits the district and presents an icy attitude toward Ruzek.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: When a locally renowned Jazz pianist is murdered, Nick wants to conduct an investigation. However, a headstrong author who wants to write a book about the case shadows Nick, creating a power struggle between the two of them.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: A woman hires Nick to track down her sister who has stolen a highly dangerous poisonous substance from a lab.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: A serial killer stalks Sylvie.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: An old flame of Nick's shows up. Although she's the one who cost him his job with the DEA, Nick is willing to let bygones be bygones, until he realizes that suspicious deaths seem to have followed her to Key Mariah.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: Nick Slaughter, a disgraced former Canadian Mountie, and DEA Agent moves to the tropical island paradise of Key Mariah. Once there he starts his own Private Detective Agency, and meets Sylvie Girard, a local travel agent. Together they form a strong friendship and quite the detective team. However, the local police squad never make it easy for them luckily they have plenty of friends to help along the way. The Town of Key Mariah will never be the same again thanks to Nick Slaughter and company!

programme.title: Science Max: Experiments at Large
programme.desc: Phil makes a rocket out of plastic bottles; crushing a steel drum with air pressure.

programme.title: Science Max: Experiments at Large
programme.desc: Simple machines: levers, rollers, ramps and pulleys can be used to raise more, move more and roll more weight than you can possibly lift!

programme.title: Xploration Animal Science
programme.desc: The Siberian Tiger is the biggest cat in the World. It takes down large prey with its 5 inch long canine teeth. And the American badgers sharp front claws make it one of the best burrowers. Plus toads undergo one of the most amazing transformations!

programme.title: Xploration Animal Science
programme.desc: Vultures' super strong stomach acid and immunity to deadly bacteria.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: This week we head to the bright sunshine and clear waters of the Bahamas. Philippe will start off getting up close underwater with Great Hammerhead sharks. Then we join a professional freediver to get a look at the world's deepest saltwater blue hole. After that it's into the mangroves to see how local researchers have been tracking baby lemon sharks for decades.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: This week we look to debunk a few predatory myths from our oceans to deserts. We join the shark research team at the University of Miami for two days of shark studies--first right by the city skyline and then further out to sea. We then head to Florida where Philippe will visit an antivenom lab home to hundreds of venomous snakes. We also see how venomous snakes use defense mechanisms to scare.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: A seemingly harmless surveillance job turns deadly; in hope of saving Kono, Adam considers making a sacrifice.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: When a zombielike man is shot, the team members are led to a madman who is performing experiments on humans.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: When Mary gets sick, McGarrett and the team must watch her newly adopted baby while they investigate the murder of an undercover ATF agent.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: The governor asks McGarrett and Grover to serve a warrant to a young computer hacker (Nick Jonas) in order to protect national security.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: An attempted murder leads the team to investigate a deadly crime committed in Hawaii during World War II.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Counting down the top artifacts that could provide evidence that extraterrestrials once walked among us.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Some 2,600 years ago, the most sacred relic of the ancient world suddenly disappeared from history.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Millions of people around the world have reported encountering shadowy entities who instill fear, shortness of breath, and even paralysis; they could be figments of the imagination or visitors from other worlds or dimensions.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: According to Ancient Astronaut Theorists, the placement of monoliths and their geological makeup could point to extraterrestrial intervention.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Ancient alien theorists speculate about why many of the architectural marvels of the ancient world bear striking similarities to one another even though they were built by civilizations separated by thousands of miles.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Antarctica may serve as home base for extraterrestrial visitors to Earth, but as human exploration of the frozen continent increases, humans may come face to face with the ruins of an ancient advanced civilization buried beneath the ice.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens

programme.desc: A powerful union activist disappears from a Detroit suburb; 45 years later, it remains one of the most notorious missing person cases of all time; the mystery of Jimmy Hoffa's disappearance features more twists and turns than a Hollywood movie.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: It's one of the most famous prehistoric monuments on Earth -- a mysterious arrangement of stones that have adorned the English countryside for millennia; nobody knows how the landmark was built or why.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: Following news of the history-making discovery of Sir Ernest Shackleton's ship the Endurance, this is a look at his historic and ill-fated 1914 Antarctic expedition resulting in the loss of the highly revered ship.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: On Christmas morning in 1945, five siblings vanish from their family home in West Virginia during a raging fire; despite the work of dozens of investigators and thousands of amateur sleuths, the mystery remains.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: They've been called the world's greatest archaeological enigma: 2,000-year-old geoglyphs made in the Peruvian desert that span over 50 miles; the drawings are so massive, they can only be seen from the air.

programme.desc: In July 1996, one of the worst aviation disasters in American history leaves 230 people dead and countless questions unanswered; it's a tragedy that changes the aviation industry forever.

Today, he has a unique opportunity to speak to the FBI in hope of getting justice for himself and the other children abused by UNOI and its leader, Royall Jenkins', teachings.

programme.title: Cults and Extreme Belief
programme.desc: Amy Bril recounts her childhood growing up in the Children of God, a group notorious for pedophilia and "religious" prostitution.

programme.title: Cults and Extreme Belief
programme.desc: Former "Moonie," Teddy Hose, tries to alert the public to a gun-obsessed Unification Church offshoot known as The Sanctuary Church of Newfoundland, PA.

programme.title: Escaping Evil: My Life in a Cult
programme.desc: After years of suffering abuse at the hands of her father, Flora Jessop makes a daring escape from the Fundamentalist Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints in Colorado City, Ariz.

programme.title: Escaping Evil: My Life in a Cult
programme.desc: Leslie Wagner-Wilson escapes Peoples Temple leader Jim Jones and the largest murder-suicide in history; Susan Justice abandons her family and the twisted teachings of David Berg.

programme.title: G League Takeover
programme.desc: The panel of G League Takeover gets your set with all the biggest stories coming out of the G League.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A 1989 Toyota Supra has twin turbos and a potent straight 6 engine; the girls will switch out the twin turbos for a single and get more power out of the 1JZ motor; Faye's windshield gets rescued from a rock chip that could be disastrous.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A 1971 Pontiac LeMans is brought into the shop with an overheating issue; the crew will upgrade the car's radiator and add electric fans, then go to work replacing some worn interior parts as well.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: One of the lifters in a 1971 Chevy Camaro has stopped working; the team will have to remove the engine in order to upgrade the camshaft, lifters, bearings, and timing chain before putting it all back together.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The crew gets one of the first Honda Civic Type R's into the shop; the car is already a powerhouse, but it's not good enough for the track, so they will give it some modifications and upgrades to make it race-worthy.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The AGG team performs some minor repairs and adjustments to a 1966 Nova Super Sport so the owner can quickly flip it.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The gang brings a 1976 J10 into the garage for comparison as they personalize a 2020 Jeep Gladiator for a customer.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The gang installs upgrades to a 2017 Ford Mustang GT they find for an empty-nester mom who is looking for some excitement in her life.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A '69 Corvette gets a top-end rebuild and a factory exhaust reinstall.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A 2018 Kia stinger GT goes from beast to monster with aftermarket goodies.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A '71 Oldsmobile Cutlass goes from an automatic transmission to a manual.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: An '03 BMW 325i needs a timing chain and has a parasitic electrical draw.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A '69 Mustang with a supercharged engine needs more throttle response.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The girls find a stock Mercedes-AMG E 55 and do some European hot rodding.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: An MGB with a Ford Ranger engine isn't running the correct fuel setup.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A Camaro swaps out its 305 small block for a 383 that will make 450hp.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The crew diagnoses and fixes some problems on a Dodge Avenger; they demonstrate how to know when motor mounts are bad, and how to easily fix a cracked bumper.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The team brings in a stock supercharged CTS-V and converts it to twin turbos; they put an intake manifold where the supercharger was, and then put in a new exhaust that includes turbos.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: This mid-engine classic needs to get back on the road; the crew goes through the engine to see if it needs a rebuild, then overhauls the fuel delivery system to get this build over some major hurdles.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The team brings back the 442 Tribute car to give it a new LS engine and finish modifying the interior for the previously-installed TKO transmission.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: Four gears are better than two, so the crew takes the old two-speed Powerglide out of a '67 Chevy Camaro and installs a Muncie four speed.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The new-generation, mid-engine Corvette is here, and the girls take one for a test drive; the C8 is already cool, but they make it better with aftermarket exhaust and some other goodies.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The girls bring in Faye's 1980 VW Rabbit for some fabrication.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The girls have to figure out why an '87 C10 isn't running anymore; they know it's a fuel problem that happened after an EFI setup was installed; they finish up with a new disc-brake kit; Bogi takes a field trip to show how custom fuel lines are made.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: Bogi and Faye show how to rebuild and upgrade an R154 manual transmission so it will last as long as the Toyota engine; they also drop a valve body on an automatic transmission, drilling it out and adding stronger sleeves to keep it lasting longer.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The girls take an old AMC Spirit drag car and get it ready for the street by changing out the oversized carb. They bring in a special guest to help them pick out the right carb and tune it on the car.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The girls bring in a rare Caprice cop car to bolt on a supercharger from a second-generation CTS-V; they'll make brackets for the intercooler, bolt on the supercharger and give the rare cop car some extra power.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: Cars die of boredom, so it wasn't great for a Plymouth Prowler to sit in a museum for 15 years; the girls show what areas to fix before the car gets back on the road.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: Bogi and Faye describe a common failure problem on a fifth-generation Camaro. The torque converter can fail in the transmission, causing the car to shake at 40-50 mph. The girls upgrade the factory torque converter to fix this problem for good.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: Bogi and Faye show how a worn-out Toyota's steering rack and pinion works, where they fail, and how to rebuild it with a simple rebuild kit.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A GTO that has spent a lot of its life in shops with mechanics who had no intention of finishing it, is brought in by its owner for some final touches, including checking gauges, air conditioning and the steering column.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: Bogi and Faye find a 1972 Challenger at a customer's house, and when they learned how it was a triple black, they discuss restoring it to original; the work starts with rebuilding the numbers-matching 340.

programme.title: Bitchin' Boot Camp
programme.desc: After a nationwide search to find the best metal fabrication prospects around, Dave Kindig and KevDogg have invited 12 people to the shop to compete for one job at Kindig-It Design.

programme.title: Bitchin' Boot Camp
programme.desc: The remaining competitors pair up for a challenge to create a signature Kindig-It build feature; teamwork is critical, and the team that can't figure it out will pack their bags.

programme.title: Bitchin' Boot Camp
programme.desc: Dave and Kev divide the group into two teams, and explain the day's assignment; the teams must navigate a tricky exhaust challenge; the losing team will have to make a difficult choice.

programme.title: Bitchin' Boot Camp
programme.desc: Project managers are chosen; designing and executing a wing on a '68 Camaro trunk lid.

programme.title: Bitchin' Boot Camp
programme.desc: A rusted out, dented fender needs repair, and at the last minute, Dave and Kev throw a curveball.

programme.title: Bitchin' Boot Camp
programme.desc: The ultimate job interview is down to four candidates, and the next test will see how well they can handle a staple project at Kindig-It Design; even with the instructions available, this challenge is not as easy as it looks.

programme.title: Bitchin' Boot Camp
programme.desc: The ultimate job interview is down to four candidates, and the next test will see how well they can handle a staple project at Kindig-It Design; even with the instructions available, this challenge is not as easy as it looks.

programme.title: Bitchin' Boot Camp
programme.desc: Dave challenges the remaining three players to fabricate a grill from design to execution, with the winners getting a spot in the finale.

programme.title: Bitchin' Boot Camp
programme.desc: The final two are ready to prove themselves; Dave and Kev throw another curveball.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Former NFL player Chad Lewis brings Dave an R8 Spyder for customizations.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The shop gears up for a big show and Dave's plans for an AC go south.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave turns a client's outdated '53 Chevy into a modern, badass hot rod.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The shop's talents are pushed to the max when a '33 Ford Tudor arrives.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The crew attempts to make history as they make a truck that doesn't exist.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave and the crew start on a 1966 Corvette, but his client doesn't want the color to be anywhere close to its original green.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The client is on board with the chosen shade of green, and the car moves into the paint booth.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A past client returns with a 1965 Mustang Fastback, and though he likes the stock look, he wants to upgrade the drivetrain, instrumentation and as many modern amenities as possible; the assembly team gets a crash course in engine tuning.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: An active-duty serviceman and his father are finally ready to finish their 1951 Ford pickup.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The 1951 pickup is painted and ready for final assembly.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Fixing a '32 Ford that caught fire after an accident.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave designs a Mustang for the ages to compete in the Optima Challenge; the build includes a new front facia and hood and redesigning the rear end.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The 1965 Mustang makes its way through the metal shop and is now ready for paint and final assembly; making it function will test even the Kindig crew.

programme.title: Through the Storm
programme.desc: Follows the 2023 season of the Red Lake Nation (Ojibwe) high school football team. Despite dwindling interest and a two-decade-long losing record, a determined coach and group of young athletes fight to keep their football program alive. An exploration in overcoming loss, the film follows the personal triumphs and hardships of the players and their families, and how football serves as a symbol of hope, unity, and resilience for the people of Red Lake.

programme.desc: Thirty-two of the best professional poker players in the world buy in for $50,000 apiece, but there's a twist. They are then randomly paired off and compete as two-person teams that share the play on each hand. programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The first open event of the 2004 WSOP would see 834 entrants create a prize pool of over $1.5 million. David "Chip" Reese and Erick Lindgren both fell just short of the final table as the United Kingdom's James Vogl enters the final table as chip leader ahead of J.C. Tran, David Chiu, and Shawn Rice as all eyes are on the $400,000 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The star-studded final table of the $1,500 Stud would see WSOP bracelet winners Men Nguyen, Ted Forrest, and Minh Nguyen looking to add more WSOP gold to their trophy case. Chad Brown would be eyeing his first WSOP bracelet as $111,440 in first-place prize money was up for grabs.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Nearly 800 rebuys would take this field size to 1,334 and a prize pool of over $1.26 million. The final table would be stacked with tournament veterans led by Daniel Negreanu, John Juanda, Mike Matusow, Lee Markholt, Paul Phillips, and Ram Vaswani as all eyes were on the $365,900 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The 831-entrant field created a $1.14 million prize pool in the first $1,500 No-Limit Hold'em event of the 2004 WSOP. Poker author Blair Rodman, and tournament regulars Joe Awada, Scott Epstein, and Kent Washington held seats at the final table, along with "The Crew" member Scott Fischman as the $300,000 first-place prize was up for grabs.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The biggest No-Limit Hold'em buy-in of the 2004 WSOP outside of the Main Event would attract 254 entrants and create a prize pool of $1,193,800. Barry Greenstein and Dewey Tomko fell short of reaching the final table, as WSOP veterans James Sousa and Paul "Eskimo" Clark headlined the final table ahead of Lee Watkinson, Thomas Keller, Martin de Knijff, and Young Phan as they chased the $382,020 first-place prize.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: At Compton House, in Newark, Nottinghamshire, Lisa Holloway prides herself on providing a home from home for her guests. Sadly, Sam and Ian Sugden are disappointed by the dust, while Dave and wife Jo, find the price for a night hard to swallow.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Dave and Jo Bate hope their guests at The White Horse pub and B&B in Ripon, North Yorkshire, will embrace the pub vibe, but sadly Ed and Jane Mitchell get locked in their room by mistake.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition heads to the Old Farmhouse in Cheshire, where retired teachers Ed and Jane Mitchell shock some of their guests by offering only a shared bathroom, but that's nothing compared to Sam and Ian's reaction to what they find under the bed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit this week is to Knockaloe Beg farm on the Isle of Man, where owners Fiona and John Anderson hope their guests will embrace their green ethos. Blackpool B&B'ers Robbie and John Welling are surprised that it is so clean 'for a farm'.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to The Arches on the Isle of Man where ex-demolition man Phil Routledge is proud of his super-modern B&B, which was voted the best in the Isle of Man. On arrival, his guests are blown away by the views.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to the Trafford in Blackpool owned by couple Robbie and John who are proud of their traditional bucket and spade B&B. On arrival the guests are pleasantly surprised, even if previous host Phil is hell-bent on finding some dust.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The last visit of the week is to the grand Sheepy Lodge in Warwickshire where empty-nester Julie loves to fill her manor house with people - as long as they don't order poached eggs.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: This visit is to the Lady Teal Hotel Boat on the waterways near Burnley in Lancashire, owned by Nick and Gina Mead.The afternoon entertainment is some freezing competition out on the locks.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the competition is to York House in Tetbury, Gloucestershire, where Brock Bergius hopes his cheeky sense of humour and perfectionist nature will help him win the competition.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final day of the competition is at Heyford House in Lower Heyford, Oxfordshire. The afternoon event is boxing, which Brock sees as a perfect opportunity to settle some scores with Dave and Alan.

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: The ultimate guessing game kicks off with the first six undercover celebrity singers PEACOCK, HIPPO, MONSTER, UNICORN, DEER and LION facing off against one another in elaborate head-to-toe costumes. Host Nick Cannon joins panelists Ken Jeong, Jenny McCarthy, Nicole Scherzinger and Robin Thicke as they attempt to guess WHO is the performer behind the mask. Between all twelve of the celebrity competitors on the show, theyve amassed 65 Grammy nominations, 16 multi-Platinum albums, 16 Emmy nominations, nine Broadway shows, four stars on the Hollywood Walk of Fame and four Super Bowl titles. One singer will be eliminated each week, ultimately revealing his or her true identity. Hear them sing, get the clues and guess the celebrity.

programme.desc: Fashion comes to Wipeout Australia as we meet Adam Gods Gift Marshall, a self styled Ad man who conquers the Qualifier. programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The chefs face their toughest Mystery Box challenge yet fish! When the chefs with immunity are able to switch up the other contestants fish, the competition starts to fire up.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The remaining junior home cooks will party their way into the next team challenge when they leave the MASTERCHEF JUNIOR kitchen for the first time to cook at a birthday party for kids ages 8-13, as well as special guests, the Ramsay and Elliot children. The team that receives the most votes from the birthday party attendees will be safe from elimination, while the losing team will compete in the next pressure test and create the French dessert croquembouche.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The remaining junior home cooks squeeze in a seven-minute team challenge, in which they must make a batch of raspberry mint lemonade for judge Christina Tosi to blind taste test. Tosi will decide which team has the best lemonade and is safe from elimination, while the losing team will compete in the next challenge, during which they must create a rad dish from a decade in which one of the judges was born.

programme.desc: The entrepreneurs are tasked with running a pop-up coffee shop in downtown Seattle.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: After a tough elimination challenge, the Top 12 junior home cooks face their next task when the judges test their senses in a blind taste challenge. Each contestant will blindly taste a dish prepared by Gordon Ramsay and then must recreate the dish. The contestant with the dish that best reflects Gordons dish will receive a significant advantage. In the next team challenge, the junior home cooks will prepare VIP dishes for a dining room of all grandmothers for their first restaurant challenge. Each team will create a unique dish of new ingredients and the team with the most votes will be safe from elimination. Find out who will move on to the Top 10 and who will leave.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: In the next team challenge, the junior home cooks will face an egg-cellent challenge and compete in pairs to see who can complete the most deviled eggs in 12 minutes. The team that perfects the most deviled eggs will be safe from the next elimination challenge, in which contestants must create their future cookbooks signature dish. In the second hour, Christina Tosi brings a special guest into the MASTERCHEF kitchen, her mom, to present the next mystery box challenge, which will feature all of Christinas favorite childhood foods. Then, contestants will compete in a tag team platter challenge using international street food ingredients.

programme.desc: The top four entrepreneurs are in Las Vegas to put on a show-stopping performance and prove they deserve a place in the finale.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the all-important main course and returning contender Mark Froydenlund is banking on it being his strongest dish. Russell Bateman is creating a beef dish, and Ronnie Murray's mixing a crown of lamb with a curried filling.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the dessert course and the final chance for three of London and South East's most competitive and talented chefs to get through to the judging chamber, today the veteran judge will send one chef home.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the head to head and the two highest scoring chefs from the London and South East region are cooking for judges Oliver Peyton, Prue Leith and Matthew Fort. Joining this week as guest judge is Kevin Gould, an award-winning food writer.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: They kick things off with their starters, but which one is going to be first off the blocks? Will it be a wild rabbit with ham hock, carrots, asparagus and morels; wild rabbit with a baby leaf salad, black pudding, crispy quail's egg, broad beans and a shot of real ale; or warm pork and apple pie with chilled tomato soup, Yorkshire cheeses and homemade pickle?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs pull out all the stops with their fish dishes: line-caught North Sea mackerel with gooseberries; pickled shellfish and wood smoked crispy prawns with the `smell of the sea'; and smoked trout soup with beetroot, cucumber and oyster nuggets.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Kenny Atkinson, Tim Bilton and Lee Bennett are determined to win but which dish will take first place? Will it be roe deer with beetroot, cauliflower and sage; venison three ways with English garden vegetables; or braised feather blade of beef and Yorkshire pudding with beer and onion gravy?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Which dessert will earn top marks? Strawberry jelly crumble with elderflower custard; a `Best of British' dessert plate - bread and butter pudding, rhubarb and custard, curd tart and strawberries and cream; or brandy snap with cider brandy cream, basil sorbet and summer fruits?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Only one chef can make it through to the finals to represent the North East and get the chance to cook at the banquet hosted by HRH The Prince of Wales. Who is going to come out on top?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: All the Northern Irish chefs want the honour of cooking for HRH Prince of Wales. They kick things off with their starters, but which one is going to be first off the blocks? Will it be quail with asparagus, pork terrine with liver mousse, or slow-cooked pork belly with peas, morels and wild garlic? Former champion Richard Corrigan will decide.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Derek Creagh, Brian McCann and Niall McKenna pull out all the stops with their fish dishes: black sole fillet with crab; seared hand dived scallops and shellfish with seaweed butter.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs from Northern Ireland battle it out with their main courses. Derek Creagh, Brian McCann and Niall McKenna are determined to win, but which dish will take pole position? Will it be loin of lamb, rack of lamb with slow-cooked shoulder or fillet of Shorthorn beef with bone marrow?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Derek Creagh, Brian McCann and Niall McKenna deliver their desserts but which dish will earn top marks; strawberry and elderflower jelly with doughnuts and duck egg ice cream, poached rhubarb with lavender ice cream or brandy strawberry parfait with basil ice cream?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Only one chef can make it through to the finals to represent Northern Ireland and get the chance to cook at the banquet hosted by HRH The Prince of Wales, but who is going to come out on top?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the national finals of `Great British Menu'. Before cooking starts the eight champions are called to London's Southbank to get a sight of the prize, the chance to cook at a banquet held at the Palace of Westminster, in celebration of everyday Great Britons honoured by the Queen. It has a huge impact on every one of the chefs, each is determined to do all he can to get a dish to the banquet.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's day two of the national finals, and the eight champions cook their fish courses. This year's challenge has been to produce dishes that are a lasting legacy to the New Elizabethan Age. They must showcase the transformation in British cuisine during the Queen's historic 64 year reign.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is main course day, the one course every chef wants to cook at the banquet. Judging the chefs' dishes are Matthew Fort, Prue Leith and Oliver Peyton and guest judge John Williams MBE, executive chef of The Ritz.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the final day of the competition, and the last chance for the eight champions to get one of their dishes to the banquet for Queen Elizabeth ll's Great Britons. Judges Matthew Fort, Prue Leith and Oliver Peyton will judge the dessert course and then decide on the banquet menu to be served at the Houses of Parliament. Joining them in the judging chamber is Grace Dent, restaurant critic, journalist and author.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The pressure on the chefs to deliver is immense, and even the Great British Menu judges roll up their sleeves to ensure that the banquet goes according to plan.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Some of the nation's greatest chefs battle for the chance to cook a glittering Olympic banquet. The feast will honour the hopes and achievements of the country's sporting heroes, and it will be a glorious celebration of Britain's culinary talents. This time it is the battle of the Scottish chefs - returning contender Alan Murchison and newcomers Colin Buchan and Mark Greenaway.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Returning contender Alan Murchison and newcomers Colin Buchan and Mark Greenaway must cook their fish course, but which one will prevail? Great British Menu veteran Jeremy Lee will decide who goes through to the judges.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Sir Matthew Pinsent takes time out to meet one of the chefs and give them valuable tips on competing at the highest level. programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Scottish chefs - returning contender Alan Murchison and newcomers Colin Buchan and Mark Greenaway. All of them are determined to knock out their rivals in the race to the banquet. programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is decision time for the chefs from Scotland. The two remaining chefs cook their entire menus for the `Great British Menu' judges, Prue Leith, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton. The judges aren't easily pleased and only world class cooking will do. Only one chef can make it through to the national finals to represent Scotland. If they win, one of their dishes could be on the menu at The Olympic Feast.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Turkey Monty is dazzled by an extraordinary display of the Ottoman Empire's favourite flower, the tulip, and learns of its sacred significance. Travelling further East to India he encounters a new type of spirituality in the tomb gardens of the Mughal Empire. Stunning mausoleums were set in vast gardens as places where an earthly king could enter a divine paradise.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.desc: In Brighton determined duo Helen and Dax have their hands full with twins, one of whom has special needs. Meanwhile in High Wycombe, newly single Valerie is looking for a fresh lease of life.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: A celebration of people who are growing their own, from vegetables to flowers, across the UK. At Longmeadow, Monty shares tips and advice on how to get the most out of bargain plants. Meanwhile, Joe visits an extraordinary food project in Bristol.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Frances Tophill is in her very first garden for a summer catch-up and an update on her progress since moving in. Meanwhile, Adam Frost meets a kindred spirit who explains how gardening saved his life.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Timber duck hunts may be the most exciting way to hunt ducks! With strange conditions following the opening of the second split, Cole and the Black Cloud crew struggle to find ducks. Luckily a good friend has a pocket of Timber that is holding birds and invites the guys along for a shoot.

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: The father-son duo of Mike and Sam Crane hunt with Tyler Jordan and Ole Miss football players Eli Acker and Jaxson Dart. The action starts off slow, but the duo got it done late in the morning with a Mississippi double.

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: Greg Camp heads back to Nebraska for the third year in a row hoping to put his bow tag on a giant 10 Pointer.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: The Black Cloud crew makes a quick trip to Northern Texas and hunt a small farm pond they've had success in in the past. As any duck hunter knows, duck hunts don't always go as planned!!

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: The guys at Realtree get together to kick off the 2023-24 Federal Black Cloud waterfowl season. Dr. Duck, Billy Campbell, Rusty Creasey, and friends at Realtree put on an epic early season teal hunt in the Louisiana rice fields.

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: Tyler Jordan hunts Osceola turkeys right outside of Myakka, Florida. After a tough stretch hunting in Mississippi, the crew heads back down to Florida to try to get some momentum going again. After a tough start to the hunt, Jordan is joined by Austin Riley of the Atlanta Braves on a different piece of ground. The hunting was slow overall, but Jordan and Riley did spot a longbeard way off in a cow pasture. The next morning, everything changed and it was a gobbling frenzy. The gobbler ended up walking off with some hens, but they didn't give up. A mid-morning move ended up paying off and the shot was almost missed by the cameraman.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: We celebrate the great times we had with the late Capt. Travis Holeman, then look to the future with a renewed passion for adventure and feature highlights from the upcoming season.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Renowned angler Meredith McCord and Capt. Justin Leake continue their quest for a line class world record. When struggles begin the moment they leave the dock, grit and lady luck ensure an epic day ends in grand style.

programme.desc: Trenton stays close to home and heads to the Lake of The Ozarks joining Austin Culbertson for a frigid couple days of fishing. The cold weather doesnt hold back the fish, though, as they target brush piles with jerk baits and umbrella rigs.

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: Trenton and Trevor pack up and drive down to Arkansas for their first experience on the White River. Though the White is much larger waters than back home, Trevor utilizes his experience to catch them even while wading.

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: The Southards continue their family tradition on Table Rock Lake. While theyre there, Trenton spends a day with Mr. Worldwide James Watson and learns some things from one of the best anglers on the lake.

programme.title: The Cast

programme.desc: Capt. Mike Anderson fishes the clear waters of Crystal river in search of Reds and Trout.

Guided by Captain Zach LeBeouf, this tasty adventure will surely leave you hankering for more.

programme.title: Louisiana Catch and Cook
programme.desc: Join us at Pelicans Roost in Delacroix, LA, where Captain Sean Thornton and Chef Jay Ducote were able to share the full Louisiana Catch & Cook experience with Texas Food Personality Trey Chow Down Chapmanwith delicious results.

programme.title: Louisiana Catch and Cook
programme.desc: Louisianas Cajun Ninja joins Chef Jay Ducote in our latest catch-and-cook adventure. Tag along as they hit up the hottest fishing spots in Plaquemines Parish with Captain Shane York and turn their catches into authentic Cajun meals.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: Similar to any good Cajun dish, a successful duck camp requires preparation. The last day on dry land is filled with essential stops to get ready for 5 days on the Bayou. Whether making sure we have the right ingredients for our favorite meals, or getting the boats brushed up and ready for action, the day before can be just as important as the day of.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: Tune in as Jean-Paul and the crew share their first day full day at duck camp with a morning in the duck blind and catfish on the jug line. At the end of the day they put their Cajun grocery goods together for an epic duck camp meal.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: It's the final day at Duck Camp for Jean-Paul and the guys. They finish up their trip with a morning of hunting followed by an afternoon filled with crawfish and catfish. The trip ends on dry land and the crew reflects on what makes the duck camp so special.

programme.title: ConQuest 200
programme.desc: Antlers on ConQuest deer farm must be removed to ensure the safety of bucks fighting and killing each other. Watch how Doug Roberts selects only the best typical bucks for his breeding program.

programme.title: ConQuest 200
programme.desc: Doug Roberts takes his knee surgeon hunting at High Rack Ranch of Michigan, from pheasant hunting to big whitetails. Doug Roberts decides to take the advice of his doctor and schedule surgery for his second knee replacement.

programme.title: ConQuest 200
programme.desc: Collecting semen from breeder bucks only happens when Doug has found the perfect typical whitetail. A 7x7 named Bruce, son of Die Hard is being collected.

programme.title: ConQuest 200
programme.desc: Join Doug Roberts as he selects his newest breeder bucks on the deer farm. Cutting antlers and visiting the annual youth buck pole marks the start of hunting season. Special guest Cody Robins from Live 2 Hunt.

programme.title: ConQuest 200

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Following the Bluefin action of early summer, Ali and Rush head back to San Diego to see what August has to offer. With the tuna settling in and a kelp fishery in full swing, Ali considers this to be the "peak" time to target bluefin tuna, mahi, and yellowtail. With each year before bringing a new twist to the fishery, this season follows suit with a "puddle" of Mahi that leaves the guys scratching their heads.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Ali and Rush head to the Bay Flats Lodge in Seadrift Texas to fish the vast shallow water marshes of the San Antonio Bay for Redfish. With thousands of acres of lowland creeks and pools to explore, this premier lodge has the tools and techniques it takes to get the guys their shots at this skinny water species.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The ability to overcome obstacles and challenging conditions can be key to success, but when fishing in Key West, cold temps are rarely the hurdle. For Rush and Ali, it's another day on the water where patience and a plan pays off with Cobia and Amberjack action that gets the rods bent after a cold weather spell in the Keys.

programme.title: How to Save a Marriage and Ruin Your Life
programme.desc: A dedicated bachelor takes it upon himself to save his best friends marriage by seducing his mistress, only to wind up in his own romantic conundrum.

programme.title: Rockin' in the Rockies
programme.desc: Shorty Williams (Moe Howard) is put in charge of his cousin's ranch, but he is more concerned with becoming a prospector. He comes across two drifters (Larry Fine, Curly Howard) who just got lucky at the roulette table and befriends them as possible investors. Shorty also meets singer Betty (Gladys Blake) and her partner (Mary Beth Hughes) and convinces them to stay on the ranch along with the vagrants. Unfortunately, Shorty's cousin, Rusty (Jay Kirby), returns early and isn't pleased.

programme.title: The Last Hurrah
programme.desc: An aging New England mayor is defeated in a hard-fought reelection campaign involving shady transactions by both political groups.

programme.title: Born Yesterday
programme.desc: Brassy blonde moll Billie Dawn (Judy Holliday) hits Washington, D.C., with her unscrupulous millionaire sugar daddy, Harry Brock (Broderick Crawford), and his sleazy lawyer, Jim Devery (Howard St. John), who has been pressuring Harry to marry Billie by pointing out that a wife cannot be forced to testify against her husband. In an effort to make Billie more socially acceptable, Harry hires journalist Paul Verrall (William Holden) to smarten her up -- and sparks soon fly between the pair.

programme.title: The Silencers
programme.desc: It's up to secret agent Matt Helm to save the day when a megalomaniac and his dastardly organization plot to sabotage America's atomic missile system.

programme.title: The Solid Gold Cadillac
programme.desc: A small stockholder-turned-corporate heroine ousts a crooked Board of Trustees and reinstates an honest director, falling in love along the way.

programme.title: Harriet Craig
programme.desc: A cold, perfectionist wife will stop at nothing to have her house and life run as she wishes, even if it means controlling her husband's every move.

programme.title: Miss Sadie Thompson
programme.desc: In postwar Honolulu, a former sex worker finds herself courted by a love-struck Marine as a religious zealot sets his sights on reforming her.

programme.title: It Had to Be You
programme.desc: Society girl Victoria Stafford (Ginger Rogers) garners a reputation for leaving men at the altar. Getting engaged for a fourth time, Victoria believes she's found the right man -- until on a train she has a strange dream about a Native American who claims that he is her true love. Awakening, Victoria is startled to find the dream man, George (Cornel Wilde), who claims to really exist, while also being a figment of her imagination. Back at home, George guides Victoria to a startling discovery.

programme.title: Don't Raise the Bridge, Lower the River
programme.desc: A daydreamer enlists the help of his British con artist friend to steal and sell the plans for a valuable new oil drill in this spy thriller spoof.

programme.title: Guess Who's Coming to Dinner
programme.desc: A daughter visits her family to introduce them to her Black fianc, whose kindness and loving demeanor changes the hearts of her reluctant parents.

programme.title: Battle of Rogue River
programme.desc: A cavalry major (George Montgomery) makes peace with Indians despite an agitator (Richard Denning) working for carpetbaggers.

programme.title: Home in San Antone
programme.desc: An innkeeper tries to keep his struggling establishment afloat, unaware that a famous country singer (Roy Acuff) and diamond thieves are staying under his roof.

programme.title: Return to Warbow
programme.desc: Three escaped convicts return to collect the money that the brother of one of them has already spent.

programme.title: 3:10 to Yuma
programme.desc: Dan Evans (Van Heflin), a drought-plagued Arizona rancher, volunteers to take captured stagecoach robber and murderer Ben Wade (Glenn Ford) from Bisbee to Contention City, where the criminal will be put aboard the 3:10 train to Yuma for his trial. Accompanied only by the town drunk, Alex Potter (Henry Jones), Dan battles Wade's henchman (Richard Jaeckel), the murder victim's revenge-minded brother, and the temptation of the large bribe Wade offers in exchange for his freedom.

programme.title: Texas
programme.desc: Confederate soldiers Dan (William Holden) and Tod (Glenn Ford) look to Texas for opportunities when the war ends. Upon witnessing a stagecoach robbery, the close friends ambush the outlaws and confiscate the stolen funds. Tod wishes to return the money, but Dan wants to keep it. After a sheriff gives chase, each man runs off on his own. They are reunited after some time, but with Tod now an honest ranch hand and Dan an outlaw cattle rustler, the two do not know if their friendship can survive.

programme.title: The Pathfinder
programme.desc: Based on the novel of the same name, a scout is sent by the British to infiltrate a French stronghold near the Great Lakes in the 1750s.

programme.title: Movie
programme.desc: The Durango Kid aims to break up Pop Ryland's gang of bank robbers but ends up saving the outlaw's son Tommy Ryland who has been marked for death.

programme.title: The Last Frontier
programme.desc: Jed Cooper (Victor Mature), a trapper, enlists as an army fort scout, and shortly after meets and falls for Corinna Marston (Anne Bancroft), the wife of a nearby fort's commander. Jed comes across her husband, Col. Marston (Robert Preston), after he's suffered an attack at the hands of Native Americans. Col. Marston forces the captain of Jed's fort, Glenn Riordan (Guy Madison), to send out Jed and the troops to fight his attackers, despite their lack of battle experience.

programme.title: The Rough, Tough West
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) looks for his friend Big Jack (Jack Mahoney) and finds out that Jack is illegally commandeering the mines and claims of others.

programme.title: Fury at Gunsight Pass
programme.desc: One bank robber (David Brian) double-crosses another (Neville Brand), giving the undertaker and others a chance at the loot.

programme.title: Gunman's Walk
programme.desc: Rancher Lee Hackett (Van Heflin) spends so much time trying to keep the violent streak of his son Ed (Tab Hunter) in check, he neglects the needs of his other son Davy (James Darren). When Ed's temper results in the death of an innocent Native American, Lee tries his best to cover his son's tracks by making a deal with unscrupulous horse trader Jensen (Ray Teal), who falsely testifies on Ed's behalf. But it becomes clear that Ed can't change, and a shootout between father and son ensues.

programme.title: The Gun That Won the West
programme.desc: Superior Springfield rifles help scouts (Dennis Morgan, Richard Denning) and the cavalry get forts built in Wyoming.

programme.desc: Tiny receives notice that his bar will close unless he pays $17,000 and his customers rally around him with a plan to save it; meanwhile Jay's hazing practices start to raise red flags.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The auction returns to the historic town of Waxahachie, where Victor needs to halt a losing streak. Moe and Mary, trying to help Mary's struggling brick and mortar, hope to score big with an antique instrument.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The auction action heads to the historical town of DeSoto, Texas. Victor Rjsenjansky tries to ruin his competition by sweeping the sale. Ricky and Bubba fight for a locker with an antique mannequin.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: As the bidders arrive at Walt's Longview auction, they notice one major problem. There's a 100-buyer swarm--all of whom are geared up to spend. Ricky and Lesa duke it out for a power tool bonanza.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The auction action heads to Irving, TX -- a town located directly between Dallas and Ft. Worth. Lesa Lewis and Moe Prigoff go toe-to-toe for a unit with a mystical item.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers return to Mineral Wells, where severe weather complicates a day of auctions--and puts a scare into Vic. Ricky and Bubba find items for a hardcore football fan. Jenny s locker delivers a bundle of joy.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers travel to the tony town of Las Colinas, where they hope mega mansions mean luxurious lockers. Hoping to assert herself, Mary experiments with new bidding calls.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The auctions take place in Oak Cliff, Texas. Jenny battles Mary for a locker containing antique electronics. Vic finds that it s all about the Washingtons. Ricky and Bubba discover a Vaudeville curio with a hidden surprise.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers return to the town of Carrollton, Texas. Victor pursues a custom motorcycle and finds more machinery than he anticipated. Ricky and Bubba go face to face with one of Ricky's biggest fears.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Arlington, Texas hosts the auction action. Ricky and Bubba take their finds off to the races. Jenny gets a chance to trade makeover for makeover. Vic eyes a unit that Bubba guesses was used for nefarious purposes.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers return to Mesquite, Texas, where Ricky and Bubba have experienced a famous losing streak. Jenny fights through a work-related injury. Vic sweats the small stuff. Moe and Mary uncover items that have them jumping and dancing. With half the buyers fighting through real or imagined disadvantages, Mesquite could be a winner for anyone with two hands -- provided they re not all thumbs.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The auction action takes place in the tiny town of Pantego, Texas. Victor gets back in the game when he discovers a box of antique periodicals. Moe and Mary find a useful item in a beauty salon unit.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers return to Mesquite, Texas, where Ricky and Bubba have endured a terrible run of luck and due to unforeseen circumstances, the Rangers get off to a dyspeptic start.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: From stadiums to amusement parks, Arlington has the Texas buyers on the lookout for memorabilia and collectables. Ricky and Bubba play up their country roots in an attempt to juke the competition.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers travel to the classic Texas town of Waxahachie. Moe and Mary meet Moe s match in wood expertise. Jenny Grumbles finds an item that could make her think like a man.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: They say Las Vegas can make or break you overnight. But when the sun comes up, the real gamblers go to work. The Storage Warriors press their luck at a marathon of auctions.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The auction returns to the historic town of Waxahachie, where Victor needs to halt a losing streak. Moe and Mary, trying to help Mary's struggling brick and mortar, hope to score big with an antique instrument.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The auction action heads to the historical town of DeSoto, Texas. Victor Rjsenjansky tries to ruin his competition by sweeping the sale. Ricky and Bubba fight for a locker with an antique mannequin.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: As the bidders arrive at Walt's Longview auction, they notice one major problem. There's a 100-buyer swarm--all of whom are geared up to spend. Ricky and Lesa duke it out for a power tool bonanza.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The auction action heads to Irving, TX -- a town located directly between Dallas and Ft. Worth. Lesa Lewis and Moe Prigoff go toe-to-toe for a unit with a mystical item.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers return to Mineral Wells, where severe weather complicates a day of auctions--and puts a scare into Vic. Ricky and Bubba find items for a hardcore football fan. Jenny s locker delivers a bundle of joy.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers travel to the tony town of Las Colinas, where they hope mega mansions mean luxurious lockers. Hoping to assert herself, Mary experiments with new bidding calls.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The auctions take place in Oak Cliff, Texas. Jenny battles Mary for a locker containing antique electronics. Vic finds that it s all about the Washingtons. Ricky and Bubba discover a Vaudeville curio with a hidden surprise.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers return to the town of Carrollton, Texas. Victor pursues a custom motorcycle and finds more machinery than he anticipated. Ricky and Bubba go face to face with one of Ricky's biggest fears.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Arlington, Texas hosts the auction action. Ricky and Bubba take their finds off to the races. Jenny gets a chance to trade makeover for makeover. Vic eyes a unit that Bubba guesses was used for nefarious purposes.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers return to Mesquite, Texas, where Ricky and Bubba have experienced a famous losing streak. Jenny fights through a work-related injury. Vic sweats the small stuff. Moe and Mary uncover items that have them jumping and dancing. With half the buyers fighting through real or imagined disadvantages, Mesquite could be a winner for anyone with two hands -- provided they re not all thumbs.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The auction action takes place in the tiny town of Pantego, Texas. Victor gets back in the game when he discovers a box of antique periodicals. Moe and Mary find a useful item in a beauty salon unit.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers return to Mesquite, Texas, where Ricky and Bubba have endured a terrible run of luck and due to unforeseen circumstances, the Rangers get off to a dyspeptic start.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: From stadiums to amusement parks, Arlington has the Texas buyers on the lookout for memorabilia and collectables. Ricky and Bubba play up their country roots in an attempt to juke the competition.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers travel to the classic Texas town of Waxahachie. Moe and Mary meet Moe s match in wood expertise. Jenny Grumbles finds an item that could make her think like a man.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase volunteers to take the Duck Commander RV out on pick up, but neglects to mention to Willie, he's taking Si, Martin and Jep along for a road trip.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase and Si embark on a turkey hunt for the annual Robertson men vs. Robertson women cook-off to create a feast of fresh wild game. With Phil's discerning palate as judge, the teams pull out all of the stops.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When a big business decision must be made affecting Duck Commander, Willie plans an employee retreat.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: It's all hands on deck for the Duckmen when an old high school nemesis challenges them to a good old fashion race... at the local lawn mower competition. But Willie and the guys soon find out that this sport is nothing short of high octane.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: With Sadie's (Willie's daughter) driver's license test fast approaching, she finds herself in dire need of lessons.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After Willie's son (John Luke) leaves Willie's pickup in the driveway with a bone-dry gas tank, Willie and Korie decide that it's time to get the kid his own car.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The Duck Commander assembly room gets an unexpected shakeup when a disgruntled Si decides to quit his job. But when Willie hires a replacement that clashes with the duck call room, Jase and the guys quickly become equally miserable at work. Meanwhile, Si turns to Phil for work out on the land turning a routine levee repair into a complete disaster.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie finds his office in shambles and alerts the authorities that the warehouse has had a break in. But soon Willie discovers that the culprit was his brother Jase, who needed supplies for an early morning frog hunt.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When a heat wave envelops West Monroe the air conditioning unit at the Duck Commander warehouse goes down, turning the duck call assembly room into a boiling sweatshop.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After Korie decides the junk piles in the Duck Commander warehouse are beginning to reach critical mass, she calls on Willie and the guys to do a little company spring-cleaning. But the discovery of an old Ping-Pong table deep within the clutter quickly turns the chore into an all day table tennis tournament. Meanwhile, Uncle Si realizes that he's many years overdue for an appointment with the local eye doctor and ventures out for some new glasses.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After attending a local radio show as a guest, Willie sees an opportunity to host a show of his own. When the station gives him the opportunity, Willie makes the mistake of bringing Uncle Si on the air with him.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: A compilation of the best scenes from all 11 seasons of A&E's hit series Duck Dynasty.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie finds out that his daughter Sadie has a new boyfriend, he wants to get to know him, while instilling some fatherly fear--Robertson style.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie decides to expand the Duck Commander brand into the winemaking industry and buys a vineyard...sight unseen.

programme.desc: It's all hands on deck for the Duckmen when an old high school nemesis challenges them to a good old fashion race... at the local lawn mower competition. But Willie and the guys soon find out that this sport is nothing short of high octane.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: With Sadie's (Willie's daughter) driver's license test fast approaching, she finds herself in dire need of lessons.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After Willie's son (John Luke) leaves Willie's pickup in the driveway with a bone-dry gas tank, Willie and Korie decide that it's time to get the kid his own car.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The Duck Commander assembly room gets an unexpected shakeup when a disgruntled Si decides to quit his job. But when Willie hires a replacement that clashes with the duck call room, Jase and the guys quickly become equally miserable at work. Meanwhile, Si turns to Phil for work out on the land turning a routine levee repair into a complete disaster.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie finds his office in shambles and alerts the authorities that the warehouse has had a break in. But soon Willie discovers that the culprit was his brother Jase, who needed supplies for an early morning frog hunt.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When a heat wave envelops West Monroe the air conditioning unit at the Duck Commander warehouse goes down, turning the duck call assembly room into a boiling sweatshop.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After Korie decides the junk piles in the Duck Commander warehouse are beginning to reach critical mass, she calls on Willie and the guys to do a little company spring-cleaning. But the discovery of an old Ping-Pong table deep within the clutter quickly turns the chore into an all day table tennis tournament. Meanwhile, Uncle Si realizes that he's many years overdue for an appointment with the local eye doctor and ventures out for some new glasses.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After attending a local radio show as a guest, Willie sees an opportunity to host a show of his own. When the station gives him the opportunity, Willie makes the mistake of bringing Uncle Si on the air with him.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: A compilation of the best scenes from all 11 seasons of A&E's hit series Duck Dynasty.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie finds out that his daughter Sadie has a new boyfriend, he wants to get to know him, while instilling some fatherly fear--Robertson style.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie decides to expand the Duck Commander brand into the winemaking industry and buys a vineyard...sight unseen.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase volunteers to take the Duck Commander RV out on pick up, but neglects to mention to Willie, he's taking Si, Martin and Jep along for a road trip.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase and Si embark on a turkey hunt for the annual Robertson men vs. Robertson women cook-off to create a feast of fresh wild game. With Phil's discerning palate as judge, the teams pull out all of the stops.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The Jase, Si and the guys from the duck call room take a field trip to a brand new local donut shop and quickly find out who amongst them can eat the most delicious treats.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie receives a special gift from a Japanese business associate - a "priceless" samurai sword, which Willie keeps out of the hands of Jase and the guys.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie pushes his work force too far after implementing new "motivational work tactics," and the guys rise up against him and go on strike.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When NASCAR sensation Clint Bowyer pays a visit to the Duck Commander warehouse, Willie and the guys are fired up to spend the day hanging out with the professional racecar driver. But too much enthusiasm about the celebrity's mode of transportation turns into a drag race showdown between Willie and Clint. Phil and Si have their hands full fixing Ms. Kay's barbecue when a trip to the outdoor grill store turns disastrous.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: It's Willie's turn to play Santa Claus at the local church this year but Uncle Si crashes the party and the event goes south in a hurry. Meanwhile, the family gathers at Phil and Miss Kay's house to celebrate the holidays in true redneck fashion.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Tomorrow is the opening day of Duck Season and the men are carrying on their tradition of camping on the Robertson Land the night before... including Willie.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Gearing up for his high school reunion, Willie realizes that he could stand to lose a few pounds. Jase and Korie set out to help him drop some weight and the strenuous battle of man-versus-waistline begins.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The guys learn from Willie that John Luke is going through his first break up. In order to make him feel better the men decide to take John Luke hunting for nutria, and impart their relationship wisdom.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When the warehouse guys new office pet (a lizard) escapes, they try all they can in order to catch the wily reptile. Proving impossible, the guys finally decide to bring in the big guns to help trap it--Mr. Phil Robertson.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: With Willie out-of-town, the guys decide to flake off work and leave to brush up the duck blinds on the Robertson land. While out, Si believes he spots what he thinks is the infamous "Black Panther,"

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie and Jase invite Korie and Missy along on a deer hunt because they believe their wives have become too "city."

programme.desc: During Duck Commander's "Casino Night" party for the sale of their 5 millionth duck call, Si Robertson wins the grand prize of $2000 and decides to buy a massage chair for the duck call room.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Can Dog complete his mission to clean-up this frontier town? With four outlaws still on the lam, Dog sets out to bring 'em in. As day turns into night and with the darkness and the danger mounting, an undaunted Dog and team plan late night hits.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: With a long record of violence and abuse and weighing in at over 200lbs, Dog's target for the day does not sound like a gentle giant. When the trail grows cold Dog turns up the heat on the fugitive's brother and sister.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Today's case involves a Samoan so Dog knows that the runner's close-knit kinfolk hold the keys to bringing him in.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and his team are out to revoke bail on Eugene, a chronic heroin addict. They find him in a squalid apartment with a huge stockpile of syringes, and they can see that his physical condition is deteriorating.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is out to make two grabs on two islands in one day. Part of the team is dispatched to Kona to nab a woman who skipped her court date. Meanwhile, Dog and the others hunt Patrick, a fugitive who's fighting in an Extreme Boxing event on the Big Island.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Baby Lyssa, who's just turned 18 and is studying to become a bondsman, gets to do some on-the-job training when she helps Dog hunt for Wayne, who's run out on a bond for second-degree assault.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Bounty hunts are always full of surprises and that is very true today. Dog is in search of a potentially dangerous fugitive, he's only 19 and charged with kidnapping and menacing.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: When an offender with a long record ducks his day in court, Bobby Brown knows whom to call--The Dog! And knowing that few souls can resist Beth's clever persuasion, Dog gives her the job of luring the fugitive in.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and the posse travel to the Big Island to help Leland track down a small-time Bonnie and Clyde couple. Their crime: theft, including allegedly stealing a pair of Buddha statues for resale. But this only masks deeper problems with the couple.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: There's no rest for the righteous and nobody knows this better then the Dog. He is committed to saving his new friend's bail bonding business, and now must race against time to bring a rogues gallery to justice.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Things are seldom what they seem in the world of bounty hunting and it is through this maze of illusions that Dog pursues his prey.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Other than bringing criminals to justice, one of Dog's loves is teaching the next generation of bounty hunters the tricks of the trade. Today he has a new student.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog believes in safety first, and today's hunt puts this philosophy to the test. The fugitive's problem with anger management increases the dangers of their already risky line of work. Dog warns the crew to be ready for anything as they head out.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: It's been quite a while since Tim Chapman put down his mace can and bulletproof vest to care for his growing family. When his old friend Dog calls asking for help tracking an elusive felon Tim jumps into action.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter

programme.title: Hotel Hell

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: In tonight's second programme Gordon tackles a pub for the first time, getting to grips with The Fenwick Arms in rural Lancashire. The pub is run by landlord Brian who, after thirty years in the business and a quadruple heart-bypass, still puts in 120 hours a week and insists on laying down the law in the kitchen. Despite their best endeavours Brian and his partner Elaine are ~250k in debt, losing ~1500 a week and facing bankruptcy within three months unless there's a drastic reversal in their fortunes.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: In tonight's programme Gordon finds a chef caught in a time warp when he tackles a picturesque but largely unfrequented upmarket restaurant in King's Lynn, a traditional market town on the Norfolk coast. For the last eighteen months ex Michelin-starred chef Nick has owned and run Rococo but his past success is now eluding him. The menu is past its sell-by date, the service is stuffy, the food is over-priced and the only thing being fed is his ego. Yet, despite debts of ~100k and the prospect of putting his home at risk and his young family on the streets, Nick continues to cook comatose in a 1990s fantasy land of his own making.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: In tonight's final programme of the series Gordon grapples with girl power when he takes on an intimate family-run restaurant in the heart of WAG territory near Liverpool. For the last three years Morgan's has been run by antiques dealer-turned-restaurateur SANDY and her two daughters HELEN and LAURA. The beautifully-designed dining room has a prime high street location and should be the perfect eatery for the trendy local clientele. But Head Chef Phil is grappling with an eclectic menu that includes mashed potato with apricots and his cooking's just not up to it.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Counting down the top artifacts that could provide evidence that extraterrestrials once walked among us.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Some 2,600 years ago, the most sacred relic of the ancient world suddenly disappeared from history.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Millions of people around the world have reported encountering shadowy entities who instill fear, shortness of breath, and even paralysis; they could be figments of the imagination or visitors from other worlds or dimensions.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: According to Ancient Astronaut Theorists, the placement of monoliths and their geological makeup could point to extraterrestrial intervention.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
